ItemLoc.Name: Radiant Wolf Sword
ItemLoc.Desc: Sword that emits a blade of energy, which is both indestructible and luminous.

ItemLoc.Name: Fang Sword
ItemLoc.Desc: Inflicts Bleeding on enemies.

ItemLoc.Name: Runic Blade
ItemLoc.Desc: Summoned magical sword that lasts for a limited amount of time.

ItemLoc.Name: Assassin Sword
ItemLoc.Desc: Inflicts Slow Down and Bleeding on enemies.

ItemLoc.Name: Brand
ItemLoc.Desc: Inflicts Chill and Pain on enemies, increasing the Frost and Physical damage they take.

ItemLoc.Name: Strange Rusted Sword
ItemLoc.Desc: “The Commander said to make this sword fit for a king.”

ItemLoc.Name: Fang Axe
ItemLoc.Desc: Inflicts Bleeding on enemies.

ItemLoc.Name: Sunfall Axe
ItemLoc.Desc:
“The Dawn Weaver’s knowledge remade us; we grafted porcelain to our flesh.”
Inflicts Burning on enemies.

ItemLoc.Name: Beast Golem Axe
ItemLoc.Desc: Inflicts Bleeding on enemies.

ItemLoc.Name: Tuanosaur Axe
ItemLoc.Desc: Inflicts Extreme Bleeding on enemies.

ItemLoc.Name: Horror Axe
ItemLoc.Desc: Inflicts Extreme Poison on enemies.

ItemLoc.Name: Brutal Club
ItemLoc.Desc: Inflicts Confusion on enemies.

ItemLoc.Name: Marble Morningstar
ItemLoc.Desc: Inflicts Confusion on enemies.

ItemLoc.Name: Fang Club
ItemLoc.Desc: Inflicts Bleeding on enemies.

ItemLoc.Name: Merton’s Firepoker
ItemLoc.Desc: “A flamin’ weapon that don’t go cold, prefect for a lad that can’t die!”

ItemLoc.Name: Blacksmith's Vintage Hammer
ItemLoc.Desc: “The smith wanted to refine, strengthen and sharpen all weapons in the armory.”

ItemLoc.Name: Obsidian Mace
ItemLoc.Desc: Inflicts Burning on enemies.

ItemLoc.Name: Primitive Club
ItemLoc.Desc: The lowest of the low when it comes to weaponry, though it can easily be crafted with Wood.

ItemLoc.Name: Skycrown Mace
ItemLoc.Desc: “The Dusk Father’s knowledge made us all kings; we built our sky castles under the earth.”

ItemLoc.Name: Fang Greatsword
ItemLoc.Desc: Inflicts Bleeding on enemies.

ItemLoc.Name: Zagis' Saw
ItemLoc.Desc:
Immense man-cutting saw of the bandit lord Zagis.
Inflicts Pain on enemies.

ItemLoc.Name: Starchild Claymore
ItemLoc.Desc: “The Dawn Weaver’s knowledge showed us the way; He came from the stars, and to the stars we shall follow.”

ItemLoc.Name: Assassin Claymore
ItemLoc.Desc: Inflicts Slow Down and Bleeding on enemies.

ItemLoc.Name: Pathfinder Claymore
ItemLoc.Desc: Inflicts Vulnerability to all non-physical elements on enemies.

ItemLoc.Name: Royal Great-Kopesh
ItemLoc.Desc: Inflicts Pain on enemies.

ItemLoc.Name: Great Runic Blade
ItemLoc.Desc: Summoned magical sword that lasts for a limited amount of time.

ItemLoc.Name: Fang Greataxe
ItemLoc.Desc: Inflicts Bleeding on enemies.

ItemLoc.Name: Crescent Greataxe
ItemLoc.Desc: Inflicts Vulnerability to all non-physical elements on enemies.

ItemLoc.Name: Tuanosaur Greataxe
ItemLoc.Desc: Inflicts Extreme Bleeding on enemies.

ItemLoc.Name: Worldedge Greataxe
ItemLoc.Desc: “The Dusk Father’s knowledge is eternal; this world is but one stop in His travel across the great void.”

ItemLoc.Name: Fang Greatclub
ItemLoc.Desc: Inflicts Bleeding on enemies.

ItemLoc.Name: Mantis Greatpick
ItemLoc.Desc: Inflicts Pain on enemies.

ItemLoc.Name: Mining Pick
ItemLoc.Desc: Essential tool to harvest mineral deposits.

ItemLoc.Name: Pyrite Greathammer
ItemLoc.Desc: Inflicts Confusion on enemies.

ItemLoc.Name: Pillar Greathammer
ItemLoc.Desc: Artifact greathammer of an executioner who guarded the Spire of Light, crushing the bones of invaders before feeding on them.

ItemLoc.Name: Manticore Greatmace
ItemLoc.Desc: Inflicts Extreme Poison on enemies.

ItemLoc.Name: Obsidian Greatmace
ItemLoc.Desc: Inflicts Burning on enemies.

ItemLoc.Name: Fang Trident
ItemLoc.Desc: Inflicts Bleeding on enemies.

ItemLoc.Name: Werlig Spear
ItemLoc.Desc:
Artifact spear of the Cabal of Winds.
It was forged to slay horrors, who are weak to lightning.

ItemLoc.Name: Troglodyte Pole Mace
ItemLoc.Desc: Inflicts Confusion on enemies.

ItemLoc.Name: Phytosaur Spear
ItemLoc.Desc: Inflicts Poison on enemies.

ItemLoc.Name: Fang Halberd
ItemLoc.Desc: Inflicts Bleeding on enemies.

ItemLoc.Name: Mushroom Halberd
ItemLoc.Desc: Inflicts Poison on enemies.

ItemLoc.Name: Thrice-Wrought Halberd
ItemLoc.Desc: Artifact forged long ago by a female blacksmith for a Gold Lich she loved.

ItemLoc.Name: Crescent Scythe
ItemLoc.Desc: Inflicts Vulnerability to all non-physical elements on enemies.

ItemLoc.Name: Beast Golem Halberd
ItemLoc.Desc: Inflicts Bleeding on enemies.

ItemLoc.Name: Dreamer Halberd
ItemLoc.Desc: “The Dusk Father’s knowledge is universal; even lesser beings can learn what we have been taught.”

ItemLoc.Name: Mage’s Poking Stick
ItemLoc.Desc: “The mage who used this stick favored magic that manipulated fire, shadow and time.”

ItemLoc.Name: Simple Bow
ItemLoc.Desc: Beginner's short bow mostly used to hunt small game, due to its lack of power.

ItemLoc.Name: Recurve Bow
ItemLoc.Desc: Compact bow which inflicts Slow Down on enemies.

ItemLoc.Name: War Bow
ItemLoc.Desc: Immense bow which inflicts Confusion on enemies, making them more vulnerable to Impact.

ItemLoc.Name: Horror Bow
ItemLoc.Desc: Bow made from Shell Horror chitin which inflicts Poison on enemies.

ItemLoc.Name: Coralhorn Bow
ItemLoc.Desc: Bow which inflicts Pain, cursing the enemy to receive more physical damage, made from Coralhorn Antler.

ItemLoc.Name: Round Shield
ItemLoc.Desc:
Basic shield of wood and iron.
Blocking with a shield is more advantageous than blocking with a weapon.

ItemLoc.Name: Zhorn’s Demon Shield
ItemLoc.Desc:
An unusual possession of the ancient great hunter.
Whatever magic used to enchant this shield is long gone, though it retains its excellent craftsmanship.

ItemLoc.Name: Tower Shield
ItemLoc.Desc: Immense shield that is quite heavy, but that protects from arrows aimed for the wielder’s head or legs.

ItemLoc.Name: Wolf Shield
ItemLoc.Desc: Shield used by the Wolf-Knights of the northern reaches, who brave the bitter cold to stop the spread of icy beasts. Inflicts cripple on shield charge

ItemLoc.Name: Fang Shield
ItemLoc.Desc: The added fangs do little to improve the shield’s toughness, but are telling of the wielder’s mental state. Inflicts bleeding on shield charge.

ItemLoc.Name: Old Legion Shield
ItemLoc.Desc: Peculiar oval shield used by the warriors of an ancient legion. Inflicts bleeding on shield charge.

ItemLoc.Name: Plank Shield
ItemLoc.Desc:
Hastily built from broken planks, it grants the ability to block arrows, at least.
This shield is unlikely to last long in a fight.

ItemLoc.Name: Marble Shield
ItemLoc.Desc: A shield made long ago to be ornamental, due to its weight, but that is still useful in combat. Inflicts confusion on shield charge.

ItemLoc.Name: Inner Marble Shield
ItemLoc.Desc: A shield that has been masterfully made, being meant for guards within a ruler’s inner circle. Inflicts confusion on shield charge.

ItemLoc.Name: Gold-Lich Shield
ItemLoc.Desc:
A shield seldom used by a lich minions, as they have no regard for their life.
Mortal agents can be rewarded with this equipment, however.

ItemLoc.Name: Dragon Shield
ItemLoc.Desc: Shield depicting a fictional creature of great power; one that is common in street theatre and children’s books. Inflicts burning on shield charge.

ItemLoc.Name: Crimson Shield
ItemLoc.Desc:
Blood-red shield used by the leaders of northern tribes.
Its bold color makes it stand out in the snowy landscape.

ItemLoc.Name: Steel Shield
ItemLoc.Desc: Common but high-quality shield used by warriors of the desert.

ItemLoc.Name: Mushroom Shield
ItemLoc.Desc: Specially grown fungus used by Troglodytes as offerings to their queen-goddess. It makes for a surprisingly usable shield. Inflicts poison on shield charge.

ItemLoc.Name: Horror Shield
ItemLoc.Desc: Monstrous shield best used in a deadly combination with a one-handed axe also made of chitin. Inflicts extreme poison on shield charge.

ItemLoc.Name: Palladium Shield
ItemLoc.Desc: Depicting a sun, this shield is praised for its high durability.

ItemLoc.Name: Fabulous Palladium Shield
ItemLoc.Desc: “Sometimes, it’s not about power, it’s about style.” Inflicts elemental vulnerability on shield charge.

ItemLoc.Name: Ornate Bone Shield
ItemLoc.Desc: Morbid shield made by the deranged gravekeeper Cremeuh, to reward you for robbing graves. Inflicts haunted on shield charge.

ItemLoc.Name: Tsar Shield
ItemLoc.Desc: Shield of the highest quality, beset with a Tsar Stone that gently emits green light.

ItemLoc.Name: Coralhorn Mask
ItemLoc.Desc: “On the festival’s first day, we celebrate the spirit of honor.”

ItemLoc.Name: Scarab Mask
ItemLoc.Desc: “On the festival’s second day, we bow to the spirit of perseverance.”

ItemLoc.Name: Tuanosaur Mask
ItemLoc.Desc: “On the festival’s third day, we cower before the spirit of death.”

ItemLoc.Name: Hound Mask
ItemLoc.Desc: “On the festival’s last day, we shun the spirit of hunger.”

ItemLoc.Name: Purple Dancer Clothes
ItemLoc.Desc: Sensual clothes that enable one to dance, or fight, without end.

ItemLoc.Name: Black Dancer Clothes
ItemLoc.Desc: Sensual clothes that enable one to dance, or fight, without end.

ItemLoc.Name: Crimson Dancer Clothes
ItemLoc.Desc: Sensual clothes that enable one to dance, or fight, without end.

ItemLoc.Name: Dancer Mask
ItemLoc.Desc: Sensual mask that enables one to dance, or fight, without end.

ItemLoc.Name: Dancer Leggings
ItemLoc.Desc: Sensual leggings that enable one to dance, or fight, without end.

ItemLoc.Name: Pearlbird Mask
ItemLoc.Desc: Strange mask that makes one want to run fast and caw loudly.

ItemLoc.Name: Makeshift Leather Attire
ItemLoc.Desc: Like other survival attires, this improvised coat has additional pockets.

ItemLoc.Name: Cauldron Helm
ItemLoc.Desc: “When calling the kettle black just wasn’t enough.”

ItemLoc.Name: Merton’s Ribcage
ItemLoc.Desc: A bizarre illusory costume of a legendary skeleton adventurer.

ItemLoc.Name: Merton’s Skull
ItemLoc.Desc: A bizarre illusory costume of a legendary skeleton adventurer.

ItemLoc.Name: Merton’s Shinbones
ItemLoc.Desc: A bizarre illusory costume of a legendary skeleton adventurer.

ItemLoc.Name: Gaberries
ItemLoc.Desc:
Common berry that only offers a small amount of nutrition and will quickly rot unless cooked.
As a fruit, these berries restore stamina over time.

ItemLoc.Name: Crabeye Seed
ItemLoc.Desc: Poisonous seed that, when grilled, is the first step in creating usable poisons.

ItemLoc.Name: Turmmip
ItemLoc.Desc: Bulbous root vegetable with mana-restoring properties.

ItemLoc.Name: Raw Meat
ItemLoc.Desc:
Edible meat that should be cooked first, as it rots quickly and carries diseases while raw.
As a type of meat, this food restores health over time.

ItemLoc.Name: Raw Alpha Meat
ItemLoc.Desc: Potent meat from prime animals, which rots quickly and carries diseases while raw.

ItemLoc.Name: Larva Egg
ItemLoc.Desc:
Eggs of exotic insects, with diverse restorative capacities.
Eating it raw carries a chance of disease.

ItemLoc.Name: Azure Shrimp
ItemLoc.Desc: Rare crustacean coveted by fishermen for its mana-restoring qualities but that can make one ill when eaten raw.

ItemLoc.Name: Raw Rainbow Trout
ItemLoc.Desc:
Shimmering fish that restores mana but that can make one ill when eaten raw.
It also increases your resistance to all elemental damage.

ItemLoc.Name: Raw Salmon
ItemLoc.Desc:
Common fish that is edible raw but rots quickly and can make one ill.
Fish and seafood have mana-restoring properties, and are quite important in a mage’s diet.

ItemLoc.Name: Blood Mushroom
ItemLoc.Desc: Peculiar toadstool that gives headaches when eaten raw, but is an ingredient in health-restoring elixirs.

ItemLoc.Name: Star Mushroom
ItemLoc.Desc: Celestial toadstool which restores mana and is an ingredient in magic-restoring elixirs.

ItemLoc.Name: Marshmelon
ItemLoc.Desc:
Heavy marsh fruit that restore far more stamina than Gaberries.
These raw melons gain anti-poison properties when boiled.

ItemLoc.Name: Cactus Fruit
ItemLoc.Desc: Heavy desert fruit that re-invigorates and protects against the sun.

ItemLoc.Name: Ochre Spice Beetle
ItemLoc.Desc:
Uncommon reinvigorating insect that lives in plants and is used in advanced recipes.
Eating this insect protects from the cold.

ItemLoc.Name: Gravel Beetle
ItemLoc.Desc: Scarab, found in mineral ores, whose resin hardens one’s body from Impacts.

ItemLoc.Name: Common Mushroom
ItemLoc.Desc: Bland mushroom which restores little hunger, often found in dank caves.

ItemLoc.Name: Bird Egg
ItemLoc.Desc:
Large Pearlbird egg that carries a chance of disease when eaten raw.
Eggs provide both health and stamina recovery over time.

ItemLoc.Name: Woolshroom
ItemLoc.Desc: Airy mushroom strands that, when eaten, muffle the sound of one’s footsteps.

ItemLoc.Name: Miasmapod
ItemLoc.Desc:
Rare marsh octopus, which closes wounds but poisons the eater.
It also instantly cures infections.

ItemLoc.Name: Raw Jewel Meat
ItemLoc.Desc: Iridescent flesh of a rare bird which increases one’s movement speed.

ItemLoc.Name: Smoke Root
ItemLoc.Desc: Fire-infused plant that grows in burnt lands.

ItemLoc.Name: Krimp Nut
ItemLoc.Desc: Edible nut that is a main ingredient in stamina-restoring elixirs.

ItemLoc.Name: Food Waste
ItemLoc.Desc: Diseased mush that is what remains when a cooking recipe fails.

ItemLoc.Name: Cooked Meat
ItemLoc.Desc: Slab of meat grilled over a campfire, removing any risk of disease.

ItemLoc.Name: Cooked Alpha Meat
ItemLoc.Desc: Piece of very nutritious and fortifying meat.

ItemLoc.Name: Jerky
ItemLoc.Desc: Salted meat that rots very slowly.

ItemLoc.Name: Alpha Jerky
ItemLoc.Desc: Salted alpha meat that rots very slowly, while retaining the special meat’s qualities.

ItemLoc.Name: Alpha Sandwich
ItemLoc.Desc: Combined bread and alpha meat, which keep the meat’s combat-enhancing properties.

ItemLoc.Name: Gaberry Jam
ItemLoc.Desc: Crushed berries boiled into nutritious syrup, with warming properties.

ItemLoc.Name: Grilled Salmon
ItemLoc.Desc: Fish cooked over a campfire, removing any risk of disease.

ItemLoc.Name: Grilled Rainbow Trout
ItemLoc.Desc:
Highly prized fish filet that shimmers brightly.
It restores mana and increases your resistance against elemental damage.

ItemLoc.Name: Bread
ItemLoc.Desc: Basic food that can be bought in any city, as many recipes use this simple ingredient.

ItemLoc.Name: Cierzo Ceviche
ItemLoc.Desc: Dish of raw Rainbow Trout that keeps the fish’s mana-restoring and elemental resistance attributes.

ItemLoc.Name: Pungent Paste
ItemLoc.Desc:
Odorous paste which restores your maximum health and stamina, allowing you to continue adventuring without sleep.
It also instantly cures infections.

ItemLoc.Name: Meat Stew
ItemLoc.Desc: Filling but ordinary dish made with whatever meat and plants are at hand, with a pinch of salt.

ItemLoc.Name: Ocean Fricassee
ItemLoc.Desc: Superior egg and fish dish with healing properties which restore health, stamina and mana.

ItemLoc.Name: Luxe Lichette
ItemLoc.Desc: Special dish of the Chersonese which restores a fair amount of stamina and a large amount of health.

ItemLoc.Name: Dry Mushroom Bar
ItemLoc.Desc:
Mushrooms pounded into a bar shape.
It restores a bit of maximum health.

ItemLoc.Name: Pot-au-Feu du Pirate
ItemLoc.Desc: Salted fish soup is more restorative and nutritious than fish alone.

ItemLoc.Name: Turmmip Potage
ItemLoc.Desc: Chunky soup that has mana-restoring properties, and will slowly heal the common cold.

ItemLoc.Name: Miner’s Omelet
ItemLoc.Desc: Filling omelet that is a good way to use Common Mushrooms to cook into a decent dish.

ItemLoc.Name: Cooked Larva Egg
ItemLoc.Desc: Hardened exotic egg that rots more slowly than its raw counterpart.

ItemLoc.Name: Cooked Bird Egg
ItemLoc.Desc:
Pearlbird egg boiled over a campfire, removing the risk of disease.
Eggs provide both health and stamina recovery over time.

ItemLoc.Name: Gaberry Tartine
ItemLoc.Desc: Gaberry jam thinly spread on bread, used to multiply the effects of jam into several portions.

ItemLoc.Name: Boiled Gaberries
ItemLoc.Desc: Boiled fruit that provides a bit of nutrition and rots more slowly.

ItemLoc.Name: Boiled Turmmip
ItemLoc.Desc:
Boiled root that increased its mana-restoring properties.
It is no longer reinvigorating, however.

ItemLoc.Name: Grilled Mushroom
ItemLoc.Desc: Crumbling fungus that barely provides nutrition.

ItemLoc.Name: Cooked Jewel Meat
ItemLoc.Desc: Iridescent steak of a rare bird that increases one’s movement speed.

ItemLoc.Name: Boiled Miasmapod
ItemLoc.Desc:
Boiled octopus that is less toxic but with lower restorative qualities.
It also instantly cures infections.

ItemLoc.Name: Grilled Marshmelon
ItemLoc.Desc: Tender fruit, boiled to reveal its anti-poison properties.

ItemLoc.Name: Boiled Cactus Fruit
ItemLoc.Desc: Mushy fruit that, after being boiled, offers an immediate jolt of stamina.

ItemLoc.Name: Ragoût du Marais
ItemLoc.Desc:
Special dish of the Hallowed Marsh that immediately heals wounds, unlike most food.
It also gives the Possessed boon.

ItemLoc.Name: Savage Stew
ItemLoc.Desc: Elaborate stew using alpha meat and a gravel beetle, which gives Impact Resistance as well as adding Impact to one’s attacks with the Rage status.

ItemLoc.Name: Marshmelon Jelly
ItemLoc.Desc:
Translucent spread of delicious fruit jam.
The concentrated melon confers an immense stamina recovery.

ItemLoc.Name: Marshmelon Tartine
ItemLoc.Desc: Melon jelly thinly spread on bread, making several rations, each with the full stamina-restoring properties of a jar of marshmellon jam.

ItemLoc.Name: Seared Root
ItemLoc.Desc:
Fire-infused plant, seared again in fire.
It will slowly remove the common cold with its heat.

ItemLoc.Name: Grilled Woolshroom
ItemLoc.Desc: Crudely cooked mushroom that, when eaten, muffles the sound of one’s footsteps.

ItemLoc.Name: Toast
ItemLoc.Desc:
Burnt slice of bread.
It fills the belly, but does little else.

ItemLoc.Name: Diadème de Gibier
ItemLoc.Desc: Special dish of Abrassar, allowing one to run fast and without pause.

ItemLoc.Name: Spiny Meringue
ItemLoc.Desc:
Thorny dessert with high health and stamina restorative properties.
It also helps against the sun when eaten.

ItemLoc.Name: Cactus Pie
ItemLoc.Desc: Dish of invigorating cactus fruit and bread that helps against the heat when eaten.

ItemLoc.Name: Bread Of The Wild
ItemLoc.Desc:
Special dish of Enmerkar that is unequaled in healing wounds over time.
It also grants the Warm boon and an increase in stealth.

ItemLoc.Name: Fungal Cleanser
ItemLoc.Desc: Medicinal mushroom dish that removes poison and diseases.

ItemLoc.Name: Stringy Salad
ItemLoc.Desc: Mixture of vegetables and mushrooms that heals a bit, but can fill an empty stomach.

ItemLoc.Name: Boiled Azure Shrimp
ItemLoc.Desc: Cooked crustacean coveted for its mana-restoring qualities.

ItemLoc.Name: Travel Ration
ItemLoc.Desc:
Bland biscuit used when traveling from one region to the next, though it can be eaten as normal food as well.
This food has no properties apart from being filling, and can even be made using Survival Crafting.

ItemLoc.Name: Roasted Krimp Nut
ItemLoc.Desc: Roasted nut that increases the metabolism.

ItemLoc.Name: Grilled Crabeye Seed
ItemLoc.Desc: Seed that becomes more toxic after being cooked and can be crafted, using linen, into a poisonous weapon coating.

ItemLoc.Name: Bouillon du Predateur
ItemLoc.Desc: Soup which restores stamina and increases the physical damage one deals to foes.

ItemLoc.Name: Gaberry Wine
ItemLoc.Desc: Alcoholic drink that makes one unstable on their feet, but reduces the mana cost of spells.

ItemLoc.Name: Waterskin
ItemLoc.Desc:
Drinking water restores stamina over time and removes the Burning status.
It can be filled at fountains or in natural bodies of water.

ItemLoc.Name: Bitter Spicy Tea
ItemLoc.Desc: Concoction that instantly cures infections, protects against the cold and restores burnt Stamina.

ItemLoc.Name: Soothing Tea
ItemLoc.Desc:
Concoction that cures the common cold and restores burnt Mana.
It takes hours, after drinking this, to fully recover from the cold.

ItemLoc.Name: Needle Tea
ItemLoc.Desc:
Concoction that helps with the heat and indigestion. It also restores burnt Stamina.
It takes hours, after drinking this, to fully recover from an indigestion.

ItemLoc.Name: Mineral Tea
ItemLoc.Desc:
Concoction that increases Impact Resistance and cures indigestion. It also restores burnt Health.
It takes hours, after drinking this, to fully recover from an indigestion.

ItemLoc.Name: Life Potion
ItemLoc.Desc: Potion which instantly heals some wounds.

ItemLoc.Name: Astral Potion
ItemLoc.Desc: Potion which instantly restores some mana.

ItemLoc.Name: Endurance Potion
ItemLoc.Desc:
Potion which instantly reinvigorates a tired body.
It restores a bit of max stamina.

ItemLoc.Name: Gep's Drink
ItemLoc.Desc: Brew that restores a moderate amount of health, stamina and mana.

ItemLoc.Name: Rage Potion
ItemLoc.Desc: Concoction that temporarily increases your weapon’s Impact.

ItemLoc.Name: Discipline Potion
ItemLoc.Desc: Concoction that temporarily increases your Physical Damage.

ItemLoc.Name: Warm Potion
ItemLoc.Desc: Concoction that temporarily increases your Fire Damage and Resistances.

ItemLoc.Name: Cool Potion
ItemLoc.Desc: Concoction that temporarily increases your Frost Damage and Resistances.

ItemLoc.Name: Mist Potion
ItemLoc.Desc: Concoction that temporarily increases your Ethereal Damage and Resistances.

ItemLoc.Name: Blessed Potion
ItemLoc.Desc: Concoction that temporarily increases your Lightning Damage and Resistances.

ItemLoc.Name: Antidote
ItemLoc.Desc: Brew that neutralizes most poisons.

ItemLoc.Name: Hallowed Marsh Antidote
ItemLoc.Desc: Strange brew that neutralizes the Hallowed Marsh’s poison, but not other toxins.

ItemLoc.Name: Possessed Potion
ItemLoc.Desc: Concoction that temporarily increases your Decay Damage and Resistances.

ItemLoc.Name: Stealth Potion
ItemLoc.Desc: Brew that temporary increases your stealth, making enemies less aware of your presence.

ItemLoc.Name: Elemental Resistance Potion
ItemLoc.Desc: Powerful concoction that temporarily grants moderate resistance against Fire, Frost, Lightning, Decay and Ethereal damage.

ItemLoc.Name: Elemental Immunity Potion
ItemLoc.Desc: Legendary brew that temporarily grants immunity to Fire, Frost, Lightning, Decay and Ethereal damage.

ItemLoc.Name: Weather Defense Potion
ItemLoc.Desc:
Concoction that provides relief from warm and cold temperatures.
Note that it has no effect on Fire and Frost damage.

ItemLoc.Name: Stability Potion
ItemLoc.Desc: Concoction that increases your Impact Resistance.

ItemLoc.Name: Assassin Elixir
ItemLoc.Desc: Powerful concoction that temporarily increases your movement speed, stealth and coats your equipped melee weapon with poison.

ItemLoc.Name: Hex Cleaner
ItemLoc.Desc:
Strange brew that removes most negative effects.
Has no effect on Bleeding, Poison, Disease and Burning.

ItemLoc.Name: Stoneflesh Elixir
ItemLoc.Desc: Powerful concoction that temporarily increases your Impact Resistance and the Physical Damage your attacks deal and grants the Rage boon.

ItemLoc.Name: Warrior Elixir
ItemLoc.Desc: Powerful concoction that temporarily increases the Physical Damage and Impact your attacks deal and grants the Discipline boon.

ItemLoc.Name: Survivor Elixir
ItemLoc.Desc: Powerful concoction that restores stamina and burnt stamina, and provides protection from hot and freezing environments.

ItemLoc.Name: Golem Elixir
ItemLoc.Desc: Powerful concoction that temporarily increases your weapon’s Impact and gives you the Possessed and the Discipline boons.

ItemLoc.Name: Great Life Potion
ItemLoc.Desc:
Concoction which instantly restores health and max health.
It also closes Bleeding wounds.

ItemLoc.Name: Great Astral Potion
ItemLoc.Desc: Concoction which instantly restores mana and max mana.

ItemLoc.Name: Great Endurance Potion
ItemLoc.Desc: Concoction which instantly restores stamina and max stamina.

ItemLoc.Name: Peacemaker Elixir
ItemLoc.Desc: Potion that grants permanent bonuses to the one who drinks it.

ItemLoc.Name: Bandages
ItemLoc.Desc: Band of thick linen cloth used to stop a bleeding wound and recover a bit of health.

ItemLoc.Name: Poison Rag
ItemLoc.Desc: Soiled cloth that envenoms a weapon when rubbed on it.

ItemLoc.Name: Poison Varnish
ItemLoc.Desc: Thick fluid that envenoms a weapon when applied to it.

ItemLoc.Name: Bolt Rag
ItemLoc.Desc: Soiled cloth that confers the Lightning element when rubbed on a melee weapon.

ItemLoc.Name: Bolt Varnish
ItemLoc.Desc: Thick fluid that confers the Lightning element when applied to a melee weapon.

ItemLoc.Name: Fire Rag
ItemLoc.Desc: Soiled cloth that confers the Fire element when rubbed on a melee weapon.

ItemLoc.Name: Fire Varnish
ItemLoc.Desc:
Thick fluid that confers the Fire element when applied to a melee weapon.
The weapon will also inflict Burning to enemies.

ItemLoc.Name: Ice Rag
ItemLoc.Desc: Soiled cloth that confers the Frost element when rubbed on a melee weapon.

ItemLoc.Name: Ice Varnish
ItemLoc.Desc:
Thick fluid that confers the Frost element when applied to a melee weapon.
The weapon will also inflict Slow Down to enemies.

ItemLoc.Name: Spiritual Varnish
ItemLoc.Desc: Thick fluid that confers the Ethereal element when applied to a melee weapon.

ItemLoc.Name: Dark Varnish
ItemLoc.Desc: Thick fluid that confers the Decay element when applied to a melee weapon.

ItemLoc.Name: Bullet
ItemLoc.Desc:
Ammunition for pistols, crafted from iron and oil.
Pistol skills often still require bullets.

ItemLoc.Name: Simple Tent
ItemLoc.Desc:
Well-made tent that helps protect against the weather, compared to a bedroll.
Sleeping in this tent gives a small bonus to stamina use.

ItemLoc.Name: Improvised Bedroll
ItemLoc.Desc: Primitive bedding made from leather, which offers poor sleep quality.

ItemLoc.Name: Camouflaged Tent
ItemLoc.Desc:
Minimalist tent that conceals the user, reducing the chances of being ambushed.
Sleeping in this tent gives a medium bonus to stamina use.

ItemLoc.Name: Fur Tent
ItemLoc.Desc:
Layered tent of thick furs that grant high resistance to the cold weather.
Sleeping in this tent gives a large bonus to stamina use.

ItemLoc.Name: Luxury Tent
ItemLoc.Desc:
Highly visible silk tent that offers high sleep quality, quickly healing the user.
Sleeping in this tent gives a huge bonus to stamina use.

ItemLoc.Name: Mage Tent
ItemLoc.Desc: Quality tent that, when slept in, helps the efficiency of one’s spells.

ItemLoc.Name: Plant Tent
ItemLoc.Desc:
Wondrous shelter born of a seed, which protects against the heat and refills one’s thirst and hunger.
This tent cannot be picked back up.

ItemLoc.Name: Campfire Kit
ItemLoc.Desc:
Deployable fire kit that must then be lit, usually with a flint and steel.
Campfires are used to cook, disinfect water, brew potions and to keep warm.

ItemLoc.Name: Cooking Pot
ItemLoc.Desc: Heavy pot that enables the preparation of recipes with more than one ingredient, to be used on a lit campfire.

ItemLoc.Name: Alchemy Kit
ItemLoc.Desc: Tools used to distill ingredients into potions, to be used on a lit campfire.

ItemLoc.Name: Tripwire Trap
ItemLoc.Desc:
Device that must be armed with a compatible item, then triggered by an enemy.
After deployment, traps can be disassembled to retake the trigger and the item inside.

ItemLoc.Name: Pressure Plate Trap
ItemLoc.Desc:
Device that must be armed with a compatible item, then triggered by an enemy.
A specific passive skill must be learned in order to deploy a pressure plate.

ItemLoc.Name: Explorer Lantern
ItemLoc.Desc: Oil lantern that shines brightly.

ItemLoc.Name: Old Lantern
ItemLoc.Desc: Rusty oil lantern with a weak flame.

ItemLoc.Name: Glowstone Lantern
ItemLoc.Desc: Quasi-eternal lamp that shines with glowstone instead of burning oil.

ItemLoc.Name: Firefly Lantern
ItemLoc.Desc: Fireflies trapped in the glass, and not oil, makes this lantern glow.

ItemLoc.Name: Makeshift Torch
ItemLoc.Desc:
Torch that shines weakly, held in the off hand.
It burns out quickly, but warms up the wielder.

ItemLoc.Name: Ice-Flame Torch
ItemLoc.Desc: Alchemical torch that cools the wielder even in sweltering temperatures.

ItemLoc.Name: Lantern of Souls
ItemLoc.Desc: Magical lamp that protects against elemental damage.

ItemLoc.Name: Lexicon
ItemLoc.Desc: Book used to cast runic spells.

ItemLoc.Name: Rondel Dagger
ItemLoc.Desc:
Dagger with a nasty edge.
This off-hand weapon requires Dagger Skills to be used.

ItemLoc.Name: Broad Dagger
ItemLoc.Desc:
Dagger that inflicts Bleeding.
This off-hand weapon requires Dagger Skills to be used.

ItemLoc.Name: Red Lady's Dagger
ItemLoc.Desc:
Ancient artifact of the Scarlet Lady.
This off-hand weapon requires Dagger Skills to be used.

ItemLoc.Name: Shiv Dagger
ItemLoc.Desc:
Improvised blade made from scrap.
This off-hand weapon requires Dagger Skills to be used.

ItemLoc.Name: Manticore Dagger
ItemLoc.Desc:
Craftable dagger that inflicts Extreme Poison.
This off-hand weapon requires Dagger Skills to be used.

ItemLoc.Name: Chakram
ItemLoc.Desc: Chakram spells are necessary to use this off-hand weapon.

ItemLoc.Name: Ornate Chakram
ItemLoc.Desc: Chakram spells are necessary to use this off-hand weapon.

ItemLoc.Name: Kazite Chakram
ItemLoc.Desc: Chakram spells are necessary to use this off-hand weapon.

ItemLoc.Name: Frozen Chakram
ItemLoc.Desc: Inflicts Vulnerability to all non-physical elements on enemies.

ItemLoc.Name: Mysterious Chakram
ItemLoc.Desc: Chakram spells are necessary to use this off-hand weapon.

ItemLoc.Name: Thorn Chakram
ItemLoc.Desc: Inflicts bleeding on enemies. Chakram spells are necessary to use this off-hand weapon.

ItemLoc.Name: Flintlock Pistol
ItemLoc.Desc:
Basic gun that needs the Fire/Reload skill to shoot.
Locking on enemies is vital to hit with pistols.

ItemLoc.Name: Cannon Pistol
ItemLoc.Desc: Heavy gun that needs the Fire/Reload skill to shoot a bullet, inflicting Confusion on enemies.

ItemLoc.Name: Ornate Pistol
ItemLoc.Desc: Gilded gun that needs the Fire/Reload skill to shoot a superior bullet.

ItemLoc.Name: Chimera Pistol
ItemLoc.Desc: Powerful gun that inflicts vulnerability to Fire, Frost, Lightning, Decay and Ethereal damage.

ItemLoc.Name: Bone Pistol
ItemLoc.Desc: Gun that needs the Fire/Reload skill to shoot a ethereal bullet, inflicting Haunted on enemies.

ItemLoc.Name: Obsidian Pistol
ItemLoc.Desc: Gun that needs the Fire/Reload skill to shoot a fiery bullet, inflicting Burning on enemies.

ItemLoc.Name: Arrow
ItemLoc.Desc:
Ammunition used by all bows.
Arrows must be equipped in order to be shot.

ItemLoc.Name: Adventurer Backpack
ItemLoc.Desc: Bag with a small carrying capacity, specially made to not interfere with the dodge.

ItemLoc.Name: Mefino’s Trade Backpack
ItemLoc.Desc:
Needlessly ornate bag with an enormous carrying capacity, once used by the spice merchant Mefino.
<color=#ff5043>Equipping this backpack slows your dodge.</color>

ItemLoc.Name: Prospector Backpack
ItemLoc.Desc:
Large professional backpack used by explorers.
<color=#ff5043>Equipping this backpack slows your dodge.</color>

ItemLoc.Name: Glowstone Backpack
ItemLoc.Desc:
Bag with a ring of bright glowstone, which negates the need for a lantern.
<color=#ff5043>Equipping this backpack slows your dodge.</color>

ItemLoc.Name: Alchemist Backpack
ItemLoc.Desc:
Advanced bag that slows down the decay of the food it contains.
<color=#ff5043>Equipping this backpack slows your dodge.</color>

ItemLoc.Name: Brass-Wolf Backpack
ItemLoc.Desc:
Exquisite bag, used by northern Wolf-Knights. It protects the items it carries and its wearer.
<color=#ff5043>Equipping this backpack slows your dodge.</color>

ItemLoc.Name: Nomad Backpack
ItemLoc.Desc:
Balanced backpack commonly used by travelers.
<color=#ff5043>Equipping this backpack slows your dodge.</color>

ItemLoc.Name: Primitive Satchel
ItemLoc.Desc:
Basic craftable bag used to store items, though it lacks a spot to hang a lantern from.
<color=#ff5043>Equipping this backpack slows your dodge.</color>

ItemLoc.Name: Strongbox Backpack
ItemLoc.Desc:
Tough box that protects both the wearer and what’s carried in it.
<color=#ff5043>Equipping this backpack slows your dodge.</color>

ItemLoc.Name: Trader Backpack
ItemLoc.Desc:
Cavernous bag with a large carrying capacity, but which slows you down.
<color=#ff5043>Equipping this backpack slows your dodge.</color>

ItemLoc.Name: Scaled Satchel
ItemLoc.Desc: Craftable bag with improved carrying capacity, a lantern slot and which does not restrict your dodge.

ItemLoc.Name: Preservation Backpack
ItemLoc.Desc:
Elite bag that strongly slows down the decay of the food it contains.
<color=#ff5043>Equipping this backpack slows your dodge and removes your dodge invincibility.</color>

ItemLoc.Name: Clean Water
ItemLoc.Desc:
Refreshing drink that carries no risk of disease.
This pristine water was most likely boiled over a campfire or gathered at a fountain.

ItemLoc.Name: River Water
ItemLoc.Desc:
Drink that carries a risk of Indigestion, a serious disease.
It should be boiled over a campfire to produce Clean Water.

ItemLoc.Name: Salt Water
ItemLoc.Desc:
Drink that actually makes one more thirsty and is likely to cause Indigestion.
It should be boiled over a campfire to produce Clean Water. This will also provide Salt, which can be used in cooking or alchemy.

ItemLoc.Name: Rancid Water
ItemLoc.Desc:
Foul liquid that should be avoided at all costs, since it is almost certain to cause Indigestion.
It should be boiled over a campfire to produce Clean Water.

ItemLoc.Name: Flint and Steel
ItemLoc.Desc:
Basic survival tool used to light campfires.
It might have other uses, however.

ItemLoc.Name: Hangman's Key
ItemLoc.Desc: A small key that can unlock certain doors.

ItemLoc.Name: Old Levant's Key
ItemLoc.Desc: A small key that can unlock certain doors.

ItemLoc.Name: Jade Lich's Idol
ItemLoc.Desc:
Effigy of a ancient undead mage.
The statue’s underside has grooves that might fit on some device.

ItemLoc.Name: Bandit Camp Key
ItemLoc.Desc: A small key that can unlock certain doors.

ItemLoc.Name: Enmerkar Tomb Key
ItemLoc.Desc: A small key that can unlock certain doors.

ItemLoc.Name: Vigil Lock Key
ItemLoc.Desc: A small key that can unlock certain doors.

ItemLoc.Name: Dead Roots Key
ItemLoc.Desc: A small key that can unlock certain doors.

ItemLoc.Name: Vendavel Key
ItemLoc.Desc: A small key that can unlock certain doors.

ItemLoc.Name: Vendavel Prison Key
ItemLoc.Desc: A small key that can unlock certain doors.

ItemLoc.Name: Cierzo Town Key
ItemLoc.Desc: A small key that can unlock certain doors.

ItemLoc.Name: Scarlet Lich's Idol
ItemLoc.Desc:
Ominous effigy of an undead ruler.
Used as an offering, this could garner the favor of an ancient power, and with it, unique rewards.

ItemLoc.Name: Palace Passage Key
ItemLoc.Desc: A small key that can unlock certain doors.

ItemLoc.Name: Krypteia Tomb Key
ItemLoc.Desc: A small key that can unlock certain doors.

ItemLoc.Name: Skill Storage Tablet
ItemLoc.Desc: Stone tablet which can be imprinted with a skill, which can then be passed down as a legacy.

ItemLoc.Name: Writ of Tribal Favor
ItemLoc.Desc: Written proof of the debt the Blue Chamber owes you.

ItemLoc.Name: Gep's Note
ItemLoc.Desc:
“Hey, you were in trouble and I gave you a hand. I can’t stay to watch over you, but I tried to make sure you were comfortable first.
Have a flask of my own personal brew, on me! You owe me one, pal!
~Gep”

ItemLoc.Name: Chemist’s Broken Flask
ItemLoc.Desc: “Only the Chemist knew how to mix poison, sun dust and demon blood.”

ItemLoc.Name: Crafting: Old Lantern
ItemLoc.Desc: Teaches how to craft a consumable item, requiring no crafting station.

ItemLoc.Name: Firefly powder
ItemLoc.Desc: Crushed marsh insects that emit a luminous haze, used in some alchemical recipes.

ItemLoc.Name: Greasy Fern
ItemLoc.Desc: Rare plants that grow on mountains and used in alchemy.

ItemLoc.Name: Livweedi
ItemLoc.Desc: Phosphorescent leaves with alchemical properties.

ItemLoc.Name: Ghost's Eye
ItemLoc.Desc: Spectral remains used in ethereal-related alchemical recipes.

ItemLoc.Name: Seaweed
ItemLoc.Desc: Algae that, when infused in water in a cooking pot, produces a medicinal tea.

ItemLoc.Name: Salt
ItemLoc.Desc:
Handful of salt, obtained by mining rock or boiling sea water over a campfire.
It is essential in cooking and in alchemy.

ItemLoc.Name: Wood
ItemLoc.Desc: Branches with a variety of uses, from making campfires to crafting weapons.

ItemLoc.Name: Tsar Stone
ItemLoc.Desc: Shimmering gem that glimmers with shining power.

ItemLoc.Name: Butcher’s Amethyst
ItemLoc.Desc:
Beautiful one-of-a-kind gem formed in the heart of a unique horror.
It is a memento from a hard-fought battle to save the city of Monsoon.

ItemLoc.Name: Ammolite
ItemLoc.Desc:
Fossilized shells of ancient sea creatures.
These iridescent stones are used to craft Ammolite Armor.

ItemLoc.Name: Copal
ItemLoc.Desc:
Ancient resin that can be shaped into armors.
Only the smiths of the city of Berg possess such techniques, though.

ItemLoc.Name: Tiny Aquamarine
ItemLoc.Desc:
Semiprecious stone found near water, unlike other gems.
It can fetch a decent price.

ItemLoc.Name: Large Emerald
ItemLoc.Desc:
Hefty precious stone with a lush green color.
It can fetch an enormous price.

ItemLoc.Name: Small Sapphire
ItemLoc.Desc:
Tiny precious stone with a royal blue color.
It can fetch a good price.

ItemLoc.Name: Medium Ruby
ItemLoc.Desc:
Moderately sized precious stone with a burning red color.
It can fetch a high price.

ItemLoc.Name: Hackmanite
ItemLoc.Desc:
Dark gem with intricate magical properties.
Craftsmen in Levant can create wizardly robes from this material.

ItemLoc.Name: Power Coil
ItemLoc.Desc:
Complex array of metals, made by Levant artisants, to power machines such as the Water Purifier in Cierzo.
A few prototype lanterns were built to use a coil as a power source, but they proved too expensive for mass production.

ItemLoc.Name: Blue Skull Effigy
ItemLoc.Desc:
Carved idol, infused with Blue Sand.
The venerable ancestors would be satisfied with this opulent gift.

ItemLoc.Name: Gold Ingot
ItemLoc.Desc:
Valuable metal ingot used to easily transport wealth.
It has no practical use but every merchant will buy such ingots at the same fixed price.

ItemLoc.Name: Palladium Scrap
ItemLoc.Desc:
Irregular lump of high quality metal, used to craft exotic arms and armors.
Crafting monster weapons often requires this material, as iron is often insufficient.

ItemLoc.Name: Petrified Wood
ItemLoc.Desc: Mineral component used by the blacksmiths of Berg to craft an unusual set of armor.

ItemLoc.Name: Blue Sand
ItemLoc.Desc:
Glittering powder used by blacksmiths to craft armors made of blue steel alloy.
It is also highly prized as a alchemical ingredient.

ItemLoc.Name: Mana Stone
ItemLoc.Desc: Unrefined mineral that radiates raw magic, used in many alchemical recipes.

ItemLoc.Name: Iron Scrap
ItemLoc.Desc:
Pieces of iron, obtained by mining or decrafting metal objects.
Decrafting using the “Manual Recipe” of the Survival Crafting menu.

ItemLoc.Name: Fire Stone
ItemLoc.Desc: Transmuted Mana Stone, using an Alchemy Kit to merge the stone and oil.

ItemLoc.Name: Cold Stone
ItemLoc.Desc: Transmuted Mana Stone, using an Alchemy Kit to merge the stone and a pinch of Blue Sand.

ItemLoc.Name: Linen Cloth
ItemLoc.Desc:
Roll of fabric commonly used in basic crafting recipes, such as bandages.
Basic clothes can be decrafted, using the Survival Crafting menu, into linen.

ItemLoc.Name: Spikes – Iron
ItemLoc.Desc: Spikes that must be placed in a Tripwire Trap, inflicting damage to enemies that step on it.

ItemLoc.Name: Spikes – Palladium
ItemLoc.Desc: Spikes that must be placed in a Tripwire Trap, inflicting heavy damage to enemies that step on it.

ItemLoc.Name: Charge – Incendiary
ItemLoc.Desc: Explosives that, when placed in a Pressure Plate, inflict lingering fire damage to enemies that step on it.

ItemLoc.Name: Charge – Toxic
ItemLoc.Desc: Vials that, when placed in a Pressure Plate, inflict lingering decay damage to enemies that step on it.

ItemLoc.Name: Charge – Nerve Gas
ItemLoc.Desc: Gas bladder that, when placed in a Pressure Plate, inflicts Ethereal Damage and Pain to enemies that step on it.

ItemLoc.Name: Spikes – Wood
ItemLoc.Desc: Spikes that must be placed in a Tripwire Trap, inflicting low damage to enemies that step on it.

ItemLoc.Name: Hide
ItemLoc.Desc: Tanned animal skin, used in many basic crafting recipes.

ItemLoc.Name: Scaled Leather
ItemLoc.Desc: Sturdy hide obtained by skinning scaled beasts, used in advanced crafting recipes.

ItemLoc.Name: Crystal Powder
ItemLoc.Desc:
Refined mana crystal used to craft powerful equipment.
Consuming this powder restores mana, burnt mana and burnt stamina. However, it burns maximum health until one sleeps again.

ItemLoc.Name: Predator Bones
ItemLoc.Desc: Assortment of fangs, used to craft equipment by binding them to iron weapons.

ItemLoc.Name: Coralhorn Antler
ItemLoc.Desc: Antler of a Coralhorn male, used to craft strong bows.

ItemLoc.Name: Thick Oil
ItemLoc.Desc: Flammable fluid used to refuel lanterns and to make incendiary weapons.

ItemLoc.Name: Insect Husk
ItemLoc.Desc: Dried shell with few uses but that can be sold at a good price.

ItemLoc.Name: Mantis Granite
ItemLoc.Desc: Massive claw of a rock mantis, used to craft weapons.

ItemLoc.Name: Occult Remains
ItemLoc.Desc: Dry remnants of necrotic beings, used in alchemy and to craft weapons.

ItemLoc.Name: Horror Chitin
ItemLoc.Desc: Wondrous shell from the mightiest horrors, used to craft extremely powerful weapons.

ItemLoc.Name: Green Horror Chitin
ItemLoc.Desc:
Odd remnants of a unique Shell Horror, proving the beast was slain.
This chitin is too unstable to be of use for crafting weapons.

ItemLoc.Name: Beast Golem Scraps
ItemLoc.Desc: Finely wrought blades from a beast golem’s jaw, used to craft weapons.

ItemLoc.Name: Thorny Cartilage
ItemLoc.Desc: Bony spurs harvested from lesser horrors, used to craft weapons.

ItemLoc.Name: Manticore Tail
ItemLoc.Desc: Spiked tail, filled with venom, used to craft powerful weapons.

ItemLoc.Name: Phytosaur Horn
ItemLoc.Desc: Poisonous bones of large herbivores, used to craft spears.

ItemLoc.Name: Shark Cartilage
ItemLoc.Desc: Flexible tissue of a crescent shark, used to craft fast Ethereal weapons.

ItemLoc.Name: Assassin Tongue
ItemLoc.Desc: Venomous tongue of a giant insect, used to craft swords.

ItemLoc.Name: Alpha Tuanosaur Tail
ItemLoc.Desc: Circular tail bone of an apex predator, used to craft powerful axes.

ItemLoc.Name: Obsidian Shard
ItemLoc.Desc: Chunk of fire-infused glass, used to craft bludgeoning weapons.

ItemLoc.Name: Gold-Lich Mechanism
ItemLoc.Desc: Box of golden gears, used to craft a wide variety of weapons.

ItemLoc.Name: Giant-Heart Garnet
ItemLoc.Desc: Large mineralized heart of an Ash Giant.

ItemLoc.Name: Conflux Supplies
ItemLoc.Desc:
Bundle of goods.
Someone else may have a use for these supplies.

ItemLoc.Name: Silver
ItemLoc.Desc:
Universal currency of the land.
Note that a hundred coins have a combined weight of 1.

ItemLoc.Name: Crafting: Chitin Desert Tunic
ItemLoc.Desc: Teaches how to craft equipment, requiring no crafting station.

ItemLoc.Name: Zhorn’s Glowstone Dagger
ItemLoc.Desc:
A great hunter’s knife that emits light.
This off-hand weapon requires Dagger Skills to be used.

ItemLoc.Name: Light Mender’s Lexicon
ItemLoc.Desc: Fabled book used to cast runic spells with greater efficiency.

ItemLoc.Name: Coil Lantern
ItemLoc.Desc:
Fueled by an advanced Power Coil, this lantern provides light for an extremely long time.
The coil can be swapped for a new one when the light does run out.

ItemLoc.Name: Light Mender’s Backpack
ItemLoc.Desc:
Bag containing the arcane talismans collected long ago by an undead wizard.
<color=#ff5043>Equipping this backpack slows your dodge.</color>

ItemLoc.Name: Montcalm Key
ItemLoc.Desc: A small key that can unlock certain doors.

ItemLoc.Name: Zhorn’s Hunting Backpack
ItemLoc.Desc:
Trophy-laden bag of the great hunter Zhorn, who used it to trek across vast distances.
<color=#ff5043>Equipping this backpack slows your dodge.</color>

ItemLoc.Name: Cooking: Savage Stew
ItemLoc.Desc: Teaches how to craft food, using a Cooking Pot.

ItemLoc.Name: Gep’s Generosity
ItemLoc.Desc: A golden flower...It hums with welcoming energies. It can be used to craft new unique equipment.

ItemLoc.Name: Pearlbird’s Courage
ItemLoc.Desc: The skull of a monstrous prehistoric Pearlbird. It can be used to craft new unique equipment.

ItemLoc.Name: Elatt’s Relic
ItemLoc.Desc: A candle effigy imbued with Elatt's protective spells. It can be used to craft new unique equipment.

ItemLoc.Name: Scourge’s Tears
ItemLoc.Desc: These sincere tears from an Immaculate scream and sizzle. It can be used to craft new unique equipment.

ItemLoc.Name: Haunted Memory
ItemLoc.Desc: The memory of a Ghost's deepest regret, exorcised by forbidden magic. It can be used to craft new unique equipment.

ItemLoc.Name: Calixa’s Relic
ItemLoc.Desc: A fragment of Calixa's original shield, shattered in battle against the Devourer. It can be used to craft new unique equipment.

ItemLoc.Name: Leyline Figment
ItemLoc.Desc: A drop of the purest mana from a Leyline. It can be used to craft new unique equipment.

ItemLoc.Name: Vendavel's Hospitality
ItemLoc.Desc: The torn flag of a notorious rebel, proof justice was served. It can be used to craft new unique equipment.

ItemLoc.Name: Thermal Claymore
ItemLoc.Desc: Using magic layered onto quality engineering, this two-handed blade emits both fire and ice energy on command.

ItemLoc.Name: Griigmerk kÄramerk
ItemLoc.Desc: A cruel spear with a long reach once used by tribal queens one hundred generations ago.

ItemLoc.Name: Maelstrom Blade
ItemLoc.Desc: A pulsing one-handed sword that seems to stretch reflexively in search of new victims. Inflicts confusion.

ItemLoc.Name: Kelvin’s Greataxe
ItemLoc.Desc: The greataxe of an adventurer who always looked out for his friends. This two-handed axe is so cold it drops your temperature.

ItemLoc.Name: Challenger Greathammer
ItemLoc.Desc: A two-handed greathammer traditionally used to incite a duel to the death against a rival. It grants rage boon and discipline boon on enemies.

ItemLoc.Name: Ghost Reaper
ItemLoc.Desc: This ghostly scythe polearm hungrily rips and tears the souls of the wicked. Inflicts haunted.

ItemLoc.Name: Pain in the Axe
ItemLoc.Desc: Every blow from this powerful one-handed axe will draw a scream from the victim. It inflicts pain.

ItemLoc.Name: Mace of Seasons
ItemLoc.Desc: A one handed mace that bends the elements against its victims. Inflicts elemental weakness.

ItemLoc.Name: Gold Bow
ItemLoc.Desc: A gilded Simple Bow, passed down by your ancestors.

ItemLoc.Name: Gold Machete
ItemLoc.Desc: A gilded Machete, passed down by your ancestors.

ItemLoc.Name: Gold Hatchet
ItemLoc.Desc: A gilded Hatchet, passed down by your ancestors.

ItemLoc.Name: Gold Club
ItemLoc.Desc: A gilded Club, passed down by your ancestors.

ItemLoc.Name: Gold Greataxe
ItemLoc.Desc: A gilded Felling Greataxe, passed down by your ancestors.

ItemLoc.Name: Gold Mining Pick
ItemLoc.Desc: A gilded Mining Pick, passed down by your ancestors.

ItemLoc.Name: Gold Quarterstaff
ItemLoc.Desc: A gilded Quarterstaff, passed down by your ancestors.

ItemLoc.Name: Gold Guisarme
ItemLoc.Desc: A gilded Guisarme, passed down by your ancestors.

ItemLoc.Name: Gold Harpoon
ItemLoc.Desc: A gilded Fishing Harpoon, passed down by your ancestors.

ItemLoc.Name: Gold Pitchfork
ItemLoc.Desc: A gilded Pitchfork, passed down by your ancestors.

ItemLoc.Name: Savage Sword
ItemLoc.Desc: A Fang Sword made from the bones of ancient beasts, passed down by your ancestors. Inflicts Bleeding.

ItemLoc.Name: Savage Axe
ItemLoc.Desc: A Fang Axe made from the bones of ancient beasts, passed down by your ancestors. Inflicts Bleeding.

ItemLoc.Name: Savage Club
ItemLoc.Desc: A Fang Club made from the bones of ancient beasts, passed down by your ancestors. Inflicts Bleeding.

ItemLoc.Name: Savage Greatsword
ItemLoc.Desc: A Fang Greatsword made from the bones of ancient beasts, passed down by your ancestors. Inflicts Bleeding.

ItemLoc.Name: Savage Greataxe
ItemLoc.Desc: A Fang Greataxe made from the bones of ancient beasts, passed down by your ancestors. Inflicts Bleeding.

ItemLoc.Name: Savage Greatclub
ItemLoc.Desc: A Fang Greatclub made from the bones of ancient beasts, passed down by your ancestors. Inflicts Bleeding.

ItemLoc.Name: Savage Halberd
ItemLoc.Desc: A Fang Halberd made from the bones of ancient beasts, passed down by your ancestors. Inflicts Bleeding.

ItemLoc.Name: Savage Trident
ItemLoc.Desc: A Fang Trident made from the bones of ancient beasts, passed down by your ancestors. Inflicts Bleeding.

ItemLoc.Name: Ivory Master’s Staff
ItemLoc.Desc: A Master's Staff made by a master artisan, passed down by your ancestors.

ItemLoc.Name: Sinner Claymore
ItemLoc.Desc: A Prayer Claymore disgraced by a fallen hero, passed down by your ancestors.

ItemLoc.Name: Sanguine Cleaver
ItemLoc.Desc: A Cleaver Halberd made by a savage smith, passed down by your ancestors. Inflicts Extreme Bleeding on enemies.

ItemLoc.Name: Cerulean Saber
ItemLoc.Desc: A Steel Saber made by a clever craftsman, passed down by your ancestors.

ItemLoc.Name: Withering Pole Mace
ItemLoc.Desc: A Pole Mace taken from a surprisingly competent ancient Troglodyte, passed down by your ancestors. Inflicts Confusion.

ItemLoc.Name: Withering Trident
ItemLoc.Desc: A Trident taken from a surprisingly competent ancient Troglodyte, passed down by your ancestors.

ItemLoc.Name: Spore Halberd
ItemLoc.Desc: A Troglodyte Halberd, passed down by your ancestors. The ages have made the fungus all the more virulent... Inflicts Poison.

ItemLoc.Name: Crystal Staff
ItemLoc.Desc: A Troglodyte Staff whose Mana Stones have matured, passed down by your ancestors.

ItemLoc.Name: Butcher Cleaver
ItemLoc.Desc: Left alone over the ages, the Amethyst heart of the Butcher of Men has grown into a fearsome weapon, eager to slay again...

ItemLoc.Name: Savage Shield
ItemLoc.Desc: A Fang Shield made from the bones of ancient beasts, passed down by your ancestors. Inflicts extreme bleeding on shield charge.

ItemLoc.Name: Golden Shield
ItemLoc.Desc: A gilded Plank Shield, passed down by your ancestors.

ItemLoc.Name: Spore Shield
ItemLoc.Desc: A Mushroom Shield left to mature over several generations, passed down by your ancestors. Inflicts extreme poison on shield charge.

ItemLoc.Name: Poutine
ItemLoc.Desc: A famous traditional comfort food of the northern tribes, invented completely by accident. Hot, filling, and delicious. Increases attack and impact, and protects against the cold.

ItemLoc.Name: – Mason’s Workshop
ItemLoc.Desc: A basic Mason’s workshop. Provides 4 Stone for the settlement each day. ---- Construction requirements Funds: 2500 Stone: 50 Timber: 20 Housing: 1 Funds upkeep: 40 / Day Construction: 3 Weeks

ItemLoc.Name: V2 – Mason‘s Guild
ItemLoc.Desc: An improvement to the Mason’s workshop. Provides 6 Stone for the settlement each day. ---- Construction requirements Funds: 2500 Stone: 100 Timber: 30 Housing: 2 Funds upkeep: 80 / Day Construction: 3 Weeks

ItemLoc.Name: V3 – Mason’s Hall
ItemLoc.Desc: An improvement to the Stonecutter’s Guild. Provides 8 Stone for the settlement each day. ---- Construction requirements City Hall Required Funds: 2500 Stone: 100 Timber: 50 Housing: 4 Funds upkeep: 100 / Day Construction: 3 Weeks

ItemLoc.Name: - Woodcutter’s Lodge
ItemLoc.Desc: A basic Woodcutter’s Lodge. Provides 4 Wood for the settlement each day. ---- Construction requirements Funds: 2500 Stone: 20 Timber: 50 Housing: 1 Funds upkeep: 40 / Day Construction: 3 Weeks

ItemLoc.Name: V2 - Woodcutter’s Guild
ItemLoc.Desc: An improvement to the Woodcutter’s Lodge. Provides 6 Wood for the settlement each day. ---- Construction requirements Woodcutter’s Lodge Funds: 2500 Stone: 30 Timber: 100 Housing: 2 Funds upkeep: 80 / Day Construction: 3 Weeks

ItemLoc.Name: V3 - Woodcutter’s Hall
ItemLoc.Desc: An improvement to the Carpenter’s Guild. Provides 8 Wood for the settlement each day. ---- Construction requirements City Hall Required Woodcutter’s Guild Funds: 2500 Stone: 50 Timber: 100 Housing: 4 Funds upkeep: 100 / Day Construction: 3 Weeks

ItemLoc.Name: - Hunting Lodge
ItemLoc.Desc: A basic Hunter’s lodge. Provides 15 Food for the settlement each day. ---- Construction requirements Funds: 2500 Stone: 20 Timber: 50 Housing: 1 Funds upkeep: 40 / Day Construction: 3 Weeks

ItemLoc.Name: V2 - Hunting Guild
ItemLoc.Desc: An improvement to the Hunting lodge. Provides 25 Food for the settlement each day. ---- Construction requirements Funds: 2500 Stone: 50 Timber: 100 Housing: 2 Funds upkeep: 100 / Day Construction: 4 Weeks

ItemLoc.Name: V3 - Hunting Hall
ItemLoc.Desc: An improvement to the Hunting Guild. Provides 45 Food for the settlement each day. ---- Construction requirements City Hall Required Funds: 2500 Stone: 75 Timber: 200 Housing: 4 Funds upkeep: 200 / Day Construction: 4 Weeks

ItemLoc.Name: - House A
ItemLoc.Desc: Increase Housing by 1. A certain number of houses are required for many buildings ---- Construction requirements Funds: 2000 Stone: 40 Timber: 40 Food upkeep: 5 / Day Construction: 2 Weeks

ItemLoc.Name: - House B
ItemLoc.Desc: Increase Housing by 1. A certain number of houses are required for many buildings ---- Construction requirements Funds: 2000 Stone: 60 Timber: 20 Food upkeep: 5 / Day Construction: 2 Weeks

ItemLoc.Name: - House C
ItemLoc.Desc: Increase Housing by 1. A certain number of houses are required for many buildings ---- Construction requirements Funds: 2000 Stone: 20 Timber: 60 Food upkeep: 5 / Day Construction: 2 Weeks

ItemLoc.Name: City Hall
ItemLoc.Desc: Provides a basic bed. Required for several specialized buildings. Provides 20 Funds per day per point of Housing. ---- Construction requirements Funds: 4000 Stone: 120 Timber: 120 Material: Amethyst Geode Housing: 3 Construction: 6 Weeks

ItemLoc.Name: General Store
ItemLoc.Desc: Sells basic goods, backpacks, lanterns and tents. Provides 100 Funds per day. ---- Construction requirements Funds: 3000 Stone: 80 Timber: 80 Material: Chromium Shards Housing: 3 Construction: 4 Weeks

ItemLoc.Name: Blacksmith shop
ItemLoc.Desc: Sells new equipment and repairs. Generates 100 Funds per day. Counts as 1 House. ---- Construction requirements Funds: 3000 Stone: 120 Timber: 60 Material: Flash Moss Housing: 3 Food upkeep: 5 / Day Construction: 4 Weeks

ItemLoc.Name: Alchemist shop
ItemLoc.Desc: Sells potions, magical items and grenades. Provides 100 Funds per day. Counts as 1 House. ---- Construction requirements Funds: 3000 Stone: 60 Timber: 120 Material: Petrified Organs Food upkeep: 5 / Day Construction: 4 Weeks

ItemLoc.Name: Enchanting Guild
ItemLoc.Desc: Uses rare materials to enchant weapons and armor with new effects. ---- Construction requirements City Hall Required Funds: 5000 Stone: 160 Timber: 100 Material: Voltaic Vines Housing: 4 Funds upkeep: 50 / Day Construction: 6 Weeks

ItemLoc.Name: Food Store
ItemLoc.Desc: Sell meals and ingredients Provides 40 Food and 100 Funds Per day Counts as 1 House. ---- Construction requirements Funds: 3000 Stone: 80 Timber: 80 Material: Digested Mana Stone Housing: 3 Food upkeep: 5 / Day Construction: 4 Weeks

ItemLoc.Name: Gladiator’s Arena
ItemLoc.Desc: Fight different regional champions to earn Medals, which can be exchanged for prizes. ---- Construction requirements City Hall Required Funds: 5000 Stone: 120 Timber: 60 Material: Bloodroot Housing: 4 Funds upkeep: 50 / Day Construction: 3 Weeks

ItemLoc.Name: Chapel
ItemLoc.Desc: A Disciple can provide a buff to increase your Barrier by 4 for 48 hours in exchange for 100 silvers. Counts as 1 House. ---- Construction requirements City Hall Required Funds: 5000 Stone: 200 Timber: 100 Material: Ectoplasm Housing: 4 Funds upkeep: 50 / Day Construction: 6 Weeks

ItemLoc.Name: Water Purifier
ItemLoc.Desc: An advanced Water Purifier, which provides much better water than usual. ---- Construction requirements City Hall Required Funds: 4000 Stone: 110 Timber: 70 Material: Diamond Dust Food upkeep: 25 / Day Construction: 4 Weeks

ItemLoc.Name: City Hall – Embassy
ItemLoc.Desc: Improves the City Hall’s sleeping bonus by increasing resistance to status effects. ---- Construction requirements Funds: 6000 Stone: 100 Timber: 200 Material: Diamond Dust Housing: 6 Construction: 4 Weeks

ItemLoc.Name: City Hall – Krypteia Hideout
ItemLoc.Desc: Provides access to an active skill trainer, who teaches you to spend Health to infuse a weapon with blood. ---- Construction requirements Joined the Blue Chamber Collective Funds: 8000 Stone: 200 Timber: 100 Material: Ectoplasm Housing: 6 Construction: 4 Weeks

ItemLoc.Name: Blacksmith shop – Weapon Forge
ItemLoc.Desc: Allows crafting of a Custom Weapon Set. Building now generates 150 Funds per day. ---- Construction requirements Funds: 6000 Stone: 200 Timber: 100 Material: Diamond Dust Food upkeep: 5 / Day Construction: 4 Weeks

ItemLoc.Name: Blacksmith shop – Armor Forge
ItemLoc.Desc: Allows crafting of a Custom Armor Set. Building now generates 150 Funds per day. ---- Construction requirements Funds: 6000 Stone: 200 Timber: 100 Material: Amethyst Geode Food upkeep: 5 / Day Construction: 4 Weeks

ItemLoc.Name: Alchemist shop – Fletcher’s Workshop
ItemLoc.Desc: Adds new Arrows and Arrow Crafting materials. Shop now generates 150 Funds per day. ---- Construction requirements Funds: 6000 Stone: 100 Timber: 200 Material: Chromium Shards Food upkeep: 5 / Day Construction: 4 Weeks

ItemLoc.Name: Alchemist shop – Military Lab
ItemLoc.Desc: Provides access to a passive skill trainer, who increases max HP and physical damage. ---- Construction requirements Joined Levant Funds: 8000 Stone: 100 Timber: 200 Material: Bloodroot Food upkeep: 5 / Day Construction: 4 Weeks

ItemLoc.Name: Enchanting Guild – Arcane Library
ItemLoc.Desc: Unlocks new enchantments for Trinkets at the Enchanting Guild’s Tablet. ---- Construction requirements Funds: 6000 Stone: 100 Timber: 200 Material: Ectoplasm Funds upkeep: 50 / Day Construction: 5 Weeks

ItemLoc.Name: Enchanting Guild – Mana Chambers
ItemLoc.Desc: The Head Enchanter will freely teach you to infuse your weapon with the Ethereal element. ---- Construction requirements Joined Sorobor Funds: 8000 Stone: 200 Timber: 100 Material: Diamond Dust Funds upkeep: 50 / Day Construction: 5 Weeks

ItemLoc.Name: Food Store – Inn
ItemLoc.Desc: Adds a room that can be rented, to provide a generous sleep bonus and resistance to hot and cold weather. Building now provides 3 housing. ---- Construction requirements City Hall Required Funds: 6000 Stone: 160 Timber: 200 Material: Amethyst Geode Food upkeep: 15 / Day Construction: 6 Weeks

ItemLoc.Name: Food Store – Communal Garden
ItemLoc.Desc: Provides a varied selection of free food ingredients that refreshes every week. Building now generates 65 Food per day. ---- Construction requirements City Hall Required Funds: 4500 Stone: 120 Timber: 300 Material: Digested Mana Stone Food upkeep: 5 / Day Construction: 4 Weeks

ItemLoc.Name: Arena – Training Ground
ItemLoc.Desc: Hires a trainer who can teach advanced weapon skills. ---- Construction requirements Funds: 9000 Stone: 100 Timber: 200 Housing: 5 Material: Petrified Organs Funds upkeep: 100 / Day Construction: 4 Weeks

ItemLoc.Name: Arena – Combat Academy
ItemLoc.Desc: Hires a trainer who can teach high-commitment specialized Passive skills. ---- Construction requirements Funds: 9000 Stone: 150 Timber: 150 Housing: 5 Material: Voltaic Vines Fund upkeep: 100 / Day Construction: 4 Weeks

ItemLoc.Name: Chapel – Temple
ItemLoc.Desc: The Healer’s Buff now also increases Status Effect resistance by 25%, and increases the cost to 125 Silver. ---- Construction requirements Funds: 6000 Stone: 250 Timber: 150 Material: Chromium Shards Funds upkeep: 50 / Day Construction: 8 Weeks

ItemLoc.Name: Chapel – Monument to Elatt
ItemLoc.Desc: Provides access to a passive skill trainer, who grants you increased Barrier and Protection stats. ---- Construction requirements Joined the Holy Mission Funds: 8000 Stone: 250 Timber: 150 Material: Voltaic Vines Funds upkeep: 50 / Day Construction: 8 Weeks

ItemLoc.Name: Water Purifier – Distillery
ItemLoc.Desc: Provides some free Gaberry Wine every week. Building now generates 100 Funds per day. ---- Construction requirements Funds: 6000 Stone: 150 Timber: 150 Material: Flash Moss Construction: 6 Weeks

ItemLoc.Name: Water Purifier – Fountain of Life
ItemLoc.Desc: Adds a source of Healing Water that regenerates health instead of Stamina. ---- Construction requirements Funds: 6000 Stone: 100 Timber: 200 Material: Bloodroot Funds upkeep: 50 / Day Construction: 4 Weeks

ItemLoc.Name: General Store – Courier
ItemLoc.Desc: Unlocks a secondary inventory at the General Store, that has goods from a few different shops from other towns. Refreshes to a different shop every 3 days. ---- Construction requirements Funds: 5000 Stone: 100 Timber: 100 Material: Flash Moss Housing: 6 Food upkeep: 10 / Day Construction: 4 Weeks

ItemLoc.Name: General Store – Caravan
ItemLoc.Desc: Allows you to pay 300 Silvers to travel to any other town you choose. Building now generates 150 Funds per day. ---- Construction requirements Funds: 6000 Stone: 100 Timber: 100 Material: Petrified Organs Housing: 6 Food upkeep: 10 / Day Construction: 4 Weeks

ItemLoc.Name: Stockpile – Warehouse
ItemLoc.Desc: Stockpile can now store up to 2000 Timber, Stone and Food. ---- Construction requirements City Hall Required Funds: 2000 Stone: 80 Timber: 80 Funds upkeep: 25 / Day Construction: 1 Week

ItemLoc.Name: Golden Crescent
ItemLoc.Desc: A delicious fruit enjoyed by Sirrocan nobility.

ItemLoc.Name: Baked Crescent
ItemLoc.Desc: A cooked Golden Crescent. Rots more slowly.

ItemLoc.Name: Golden Jam
ItemLoc.Desc: Mashed and preserved Golden Crescent.

ItemLoc.Name: Golden Tartine
ItemLoc.Desc: Golden Jam, spread across bread, to make more food portions out of it.

ItemLoc.Name: Rainbow Peach
ItemLoc.Desc: A rare volcanic fruit. Has properties that resist elements.

ItemLoc.Name: Peach Seeds
ItemLoc.Desc: Dense seeds useful as an alchemical reagent.

ItemLoc.Name: Maize
ItemLoc.Desc: A staple food for those living in the Caldera. Quite filling.

ItemLoc.Name: Popped Maize
ItemLoc.Desc: A delightful salty snack, good for filling an empty stomach.

ItemLoc.Name: Pypherfish
ItemLoc.Desc: A toxic fish. Requires some work to make safely edible.

ItemLoc.Name: Grilled Pypherfish
ItemLoc.Desc: A mana-heavy cooked fish. The toxins have been cooked into the meat...

ItemLoc.Name: Raw Torcrab Meat
ItemLoc.Desc: A spicy hunk of Torcrab Meat.

ItemLoc.Name: Torcrab Egg
ItemLoc.Desc: A Torcrab’s Egg. Cook before eating.

ItemLoc.Name: Cooked Torcrab Egg
ItemLoc.Desc: A Cooked Torcrab Egg, free of diseases.

ItemLoc.Name: Grilled Torcrab Meat
ItemLoc.Desc: Spicy, but safe Torcrab Meat.

ItemLoc.Name: Torcrab Sandwich
ItemLoc.Desc: A lightly grilled Torcrab Sandwich, a Warrior favourite.

ItemLoc.Name: Battered Maize
ItemLoc.Desc: Maize coated with delicious salty Torcrab Egg Yolk.

ItemLoc.Name: Cool Rainbow Jam
ItemLoc.Desc: A chilly jam that provides some Barrier, Mana regeneration, and Heat Resist.

ItemLoc.Name: Frosted Crescent
ItemLoc.Desc: A Golden Crescent, rolled in Frosted Powder. Protects against the heat.

ItemLoc.Name: Frosted Maize
ItemLoc.Desc: A head of Maize, rolled in Frosted Powder. Protects against the heat.

ItemLoc.Name: Torcrab Jerky
ItemLoc.Desc: Spicy, long-lasting, strengthening Jerky.

ItemLoc.Name: Cured Pypherfish
ItemLoc.Desc: The toxins have been cleansed out of the meat, leaving behind protective qualities.

ItemLoc.Name: Maize Mash
ItemLoc.Desc: Typical Worker’s food. Provides health regeneration and Discipline.

ItemLoc.Name: Frosted Delight
ItemLoc.Desc: A rare chilly delectable treat. Provides heat resistance, Barrier, and high Stamina regeneration.

ItemLoc.Name: Vagabond’s Gelatin
ItemLoc.Desc: A jam containing the properties of several regional jams. Provides unparalleled benefits.

ItemLoc.Name: Vagabond’s Tartine
ItemLoc.Desc: Vagabond’s Gelatin, spread across bread, to make more food portions out of it.

ItemLoc.Name: Rainbow Tartine
ItemLoc.Desc: Rainbow Jam, spread across bread, to make more food portions out of it.

ItemLoc.Name: Iced Tea
ItemLoc.Desc: Recovers Burnt Mana, provides the Cool Boon and begins the process of curing Indigestion.

ItemLoc.Name: Greasy Tea
ItemLoc.Desc: Recovers Burnt Health, and begins the process of curing Ambraine Withdrawal.

ItemLoc.Name: Chalcedony
ItemLoc.Desc: An Alloy of Quartz and other minerals that is strong enough to be forged.

ItemLoc.Name: Ambraine
ItemLoc.Desc: An herb that, when smoked, mitigates the effects of heat and volcanic ash. However, it causes long lasting side effects...

ItemLoc.Name: Crysocolla Beetle
ItemLoc.Desc: A Volcanic beetle that lives in grease and oil.

ItemLoc.Name: Funnel Beetle
ItemLoc.Desc: A Volcanic Beetle that naturally turns heat into cold as sustenance.

ItemLoc.Name: Ableroot
ItemLoc.Desc: An essential ingredient to advanced medicines.

ItemLoc.Name: Sulphuric Mushroom
ItemLoc.Desc: A combustible mushroom that is key to many alchemical recipes.

ItemLoc.Name: Hexa Stone
ItemLoc.Desc: A glowing blue stone in the shape of a flawless hexagon.

ItemLoc.Name: Calygrey Hairs
ItemLoc.Desc: Easily gathers static electricity...

ItemLoc.Name: Myrm Tongue
ItemLoc.Desc: Coated with easily ignited oil...

ItemLoc.Name: Dweller’s Brain
ItemLoc.Desc: This organ still pulses with ethereal life!

ItemLoc.Name: Gargoyle Urn Shard
ItemLoc.Desc: Small drops of mist cling to this magical urn.

ItemLoc.Name: Frosted Powder
ItemLoc.Desc: A powder that has a chilling effect when used in foods.

ItemLoc.Name: Panacea
ItemLoc.Desc: A miraculous potion that cures all negative effects.

ItemLoc.Name: Sulphur Potion
ItemLoc.Desc: A bitter potion that offers greater strength, but reduces status resistance.

ItemLoc.Name: Bracing Potion
ItemLoc.Desc: Provides resistance to status effects for 60 seconds.

ItemLoc.Name: Shimmer Potion
ItemLoc.Desc: Grants Barrier, and 15% buff to elemental attack.

ItemLoc.Name: Mana Belly Potion
ItemLoc.Desc: Grants Mana Regeneration, minor Protection, and reduced Mana Cost for a short duration.

ItemLoc.Name: Marathon Potion
ItemLoc.Desc: Increases movement speed.

ItemLoc.Name: Barrier Potion
ItemLoc.Desc: Grants Barrier.

ItemLoc.Name: Calygrey Bone Cage
ItemLoc.Desc: Grants healing over time, and improved physical strength.

ItemLoc.Name: Fire Totemic Lodge
ItemLoc.Desc: Improves your Fire power, and weakens your Ice resistance.

ItemLoc.Name: Ice Totemic Lodge
ItemLoc.Desc: Improves your Ice power, and weakens your Fire resistance.

ItemLoc.Name: Lightning Totemic Lodge
ItemLoc.Desc: Improves your Lightning power, and weakens your Decay resistance.

ItemLoc.Name: Corruption Totemic Lodge
ItemLoc.Desc: Improves your Decay power, and weakens your Lightning resistance.

ItemLoc.Name: Ethereal Totemic Lodge
ItemLoc.Desc: Improves your Ethereal power, and weakens your Physical resistance.

ItemLoc.Name: Large Chalcedony Stone
ItemLoc.Desc: Must be charged in the depths of a Volcano’s basin. It’s too heavy to carry inside another backpack!

ItemLoc.Name: Charged Forge Stone
ItemLoc.Desc: A fully charged Forge Stone, as requested by Josef. It’s too heavy to carry inside another backpack!

ItemLoc.Name: Chalcedony Backpack
ItemLoc.Desc: Provides 15 resistance to heat when worn.

ItemLoc.Name: Dusk Backpack
ItemLoc.Desc: Provides 5 Barrier.

ItemLoc.Name: Brigand’s Backpack
ItemLoc.Desc: Increases your Physical Damage by 15%. Does not impede rolling.

ItemLoc.Name: Able Tea
ItemLoc.Desc: Recovers Burnt Health and Burnt Stamina, and cures Infections instantly.

ItemLoc.Name: Oil Bomb
ItemLoc.Desc: Explodes after a moment, dealing Fire Damage and the Scorched Hex.

ItemLoc.Name: Fragment Bomb
ItemLoc.Desc: Explodes after a moment, dealing Damage and Impact. Guaranteed Bleeding.

ItemLoc.Name: Frost Bomb
ItemLoc.Desc: Explodes after a moment, dealing Ice Damage and Slow Down.

ItemLoc.Name: Spark Bomb
ItemLoc.Desc: Explodes after a moment, dealing Lightning Damage.

ItemLoc.Name: Flaming Bomb
ItemLoc.Desc: Explodes after a moment, dealing Fire Damage and the Burning status.

ItemLoc.Name: Toxin Bomb
ItemLoc.Desc: Explodes after a moment, dealing Decay Damage and the Plague Status.

ItemLoc.Name: Nerve Bomb
ItemLoc.Desc: Explodes after a moment, dealing Ethereal Damage and the Confusion status.

ItemLoc.Name: Blazing Bomb
ItemLoc.Desc: Explodes after a moment, igniting into a deadly blaze on contact with existing flames.

ItemLoc.Name: Bomb Kit
ItemLoc.Desc: A carefully designed casing for holding more volatile reagents, required for crafting more powerful bombs.

ItemLoc.Name: Arrowhead Kit
ItemLoc.Desc: Hollow Arrowheads, required to craft special arrows.

ItemLoc.Name: Flaming Arrow
ItemLoc.Desc: Deals Fire damage, and the Burning Status after a few hits.

ItemLoc.Name: Poison Arrow

ItemLoc.Name: Long Handle

ItemLoc.Name: Trinket Handle
ItemLoc.Desc: A glimmering handle. Combined with something else, this would fit an off-hand weapon.

ItemLoc.Name: Shaft Handle
ItemLoc.Desc: A glimmering handle. Combined with something else, this would fit a long weapon.

ItemLoc.Name: Blade Prism
ItemLoc.Desc: A strange prism. Combined with something else, this could make a slashing weapon.

ItemLoc.Name: Blunt Prism
ItemLoc.Desc: A strange prism. Combined with something else, this could make a smashing weapon.

ItemLoc.Name: Flat Prism
ItemLoc.Desc: A strange prism. Combined with something else, this could make a cleaving weapon.

ItemLoc.Name: Spike Prism
ItemLoc.Desc: A strange prism. Combined with something else, this could make a stabbing weapon.

ItemLoc.Name: Gep’s Blade
ItemLoc.Desc: A blade left behind by Gep for a worthy adventurer. Unleashes powerful Ethereal Blasts, but reduces your Ethereal resistance. Craft it with Gep’s Generosity to change its shape.

ItemLoc.Name: Gep’s Longblade
ItemLoc.Desc: A long blade left behind by Gep for a worthy adventurer. Unleashes powerful Ethereal Blasts, but reduces your Ethereal resistance. Craft it with Gep’s Generosity to change its shape.

ItemLoc.Name: Scepter of the Cruel Priest
ItemLoc.Desc: A horrifying mace that brings miserable decay to all it strikes. Reduces your Light resistance

ItemLoc.Name: Ghost Parallel
ItemLoc.Desc: A strange foreign device, tuned to an ethereal frequency...Inflicts Aetherbomb on foes, but reduces your Physical resistance.

ItemLoc.Name: Sandrose
ItemLoc.Desc: An axe safely holding the power of a volcano. Rapidly inflicts Blaze on a burning target, but reduces your Cold resistance.

ItemLoc.Name: Grind
ItemLoc.Desc: An unorthodox Calygrey Instrument used by a great warrior. Reduces your Impact and Decay resistance.

ItemLoc.Name: Shriek
ItemLoc.Desc: A monstrously diseased spear. Inflicts Plague on hit, which can spread dangerously. Can poison you when you strike with it.

ItemLoc.Name: Duty
ItemLoc.Desc: The lance of a hero, whose mortality was proved in the Caldera. Inflicts both Burning and Holy Blaze, but reduces your Stamina Recovery.

ItemLoc.Name: Revenant Moon
ItemLoc.Desc: A staff humming with the Scarlet Lady’s immense power...It hungers for your mana and raises the temperature around you... Inflicts Blaze.

ItemLoc.Name: Murmure
ItemLoc.Desc: “The Inside Wind is above all, the Inside Wind is within all. To corrupt or destroy it is the greatest evil”. Reduces your Stamina costs -15%.

ItemLoc.Name: Distorted Experiment
ItemLoc.Desc:
A Chakram attuned to... A variety of other places... Dangerously unstable, not meant for human use!
Chakram spells are necessary to use this off-hand weapon.

ItemLoc.Name: Tokebakicit
ItemLoc.Desc: Sti, this thing is cold! Better bundle up before wearing it! Inflicts Chill and Slow, but reduces your Fire Resistance and lowers the temperature around you.

ItemLoc.Name: Angler Shield
ItemLoc.Desc: Makes the player immune to Petrification, Plague, and Breathless. Provides light that only the wielder can see.

ItemLoc.Name: Gilded Shiver of Tramontane
ItemLoc.Desc:
A luxurious dagger from the far North, whose frigid cold can inflict Hamper, Slow, and Cripple on foes. Reduces your Fire resistance.
Dagger skills are necessary to use this off-hand weapon.

ItemLoc.Name: Smelly Sealed Box
ItemLoc.Desc: A gross-smelling locked box...Perhaps an unsupervised smithy might have the tools to force this open...

ItemLoc.Name: Scarlet Whisper
ItemLoc.Desc: Severed threads of the Scarlet Lady’s influence...It can be used to craft new unique equipment.

ItemLoc.Name: Noble’s Greed
ItemLoc.Desc: Gemstone encrusted chains, used for a Noble’s prisoners. It can be used to craft new unique equipment.

ItemLoc.Name: Calygrey’s Wisdom
ItemLoc.Desc: A puzzle box, fashioned by Calygrey Elders from old dice. It can be used to craft new unique equipment.

ItemLoc.Name: Mysterious Long Blade
ItemLoc.Desc: A cracked ancient blade that appears wherever it is needed... Could these 3 cracks be healed?

ItemLoc.Name: Mysterious Blade
ItemLoc.Desc: A cracked ancient blade that appears wherever it is needed... Could these 3 cracks be healed?

ItemLoc.Name: Sealed Mace
ItemLoc.Desc: An ancient porcelain mace, sealed by some strange language...

ItemLoc.Name: De-powered Bludgeon
ItemLoc.Desc: An ancient large bludgeon...There are two small reservoirs for different thick liquids...

ItemLoc.Name: Warm Axe
ItemLoc.Desc: A strangely warm axe...Could this heat be intensified somehow?

ItemLoc.Name: Fossilized Greataxe
ItemLoc.Desc: This Calygrey Axe seems like an instrument...The fossilized bones are cracked...Perhaps it could be repaired with some kind of Calygrey magic?

ItemLoc.Name: Rusted Spear
ItemLoc.Desc: An ancient rusty spear...Perhaps something dangerously acidic could free it from the rust?

ItemLoc.Name: Ruined Halberd
ItemLoc.Desc: The silk banner is completely ruined...Could someone restore it to beauty?

ItemLoc.Name: Cracked Red Moon
ItemLoc.Desc: Inflicts Blaze. The gemstone atop the Scarlet Avatar’s staff has been cracked and should be replaced....

ItemLoc.Name: Ceremonial Bow
ItemLoc.Desc: The white feathers adorning this weapon have been ruined...Perhaps replacements could be added?

ItemLoc.Name: Experimental Chakram
ItemLoc.Desc:
This strange weapon fell from a strange hole in the air...Perhaps it is attuned to more?
Chakram spells are necessary to use this off-hand weapon.

ItemLoc.Name: Unusual Knuckles
ItemLoc.Desc: These cracked chromium knuckles are ruined by dried blood that can’t be just washed off...

ItemLoc.Name: Slumbering Shield
ItemLoc.Desc: This shield reacts to petrified flesh...What would happen if you and someone very large were covered in it...?

ItemLoc.Name: Scarred Dagger
ItemLoc.Desc:
This scratched diamond dagger could use a shiny new finish, sealed onto it with flash fire...
This off-hand weapon requires Dagger Skills to be used.

ItemLoc.Name: Ghost Drum

ItemLoc.Desc: Sealed instructions for how to create a specific enchantment.

ItemLoc.Desc: Crawlberry Jam, spread on top of bread.

ItemLoc.Desc: Teaches how to craft food, using a Cooking Pot.

ItemLoc.Name: Cooking: Crawlberry Tartine
ItemLoc.Desc: Teaches how to craft food, using a Cooking Pot.
